definition: to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
key (on a piano or computer keyboard)/button (on a mouse or other device)/chemical bond/linchpin

sentences.english: Students can go through it after the ionic bonds taught.
sentences.chinese: 适合在教授离子键后给学生做总结。

sentences.english: I formed a bond, an ionic bond.
Well, on the one hand, we have ionic bonding where we have complete sharing.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，一方面，离子键有完全的贡献。

sentences.english: Again, the bonds soluble in water.
sentences.chinese: 不过，离子键在水中可溶。

sentences.english: The larger the difference in electronegativity between two atoms, the more ionic the bond .
sentences.chinese: 现实中，原子间并不形成“纯”离子键。

sentences.english: So, those are the ones that most likely form ionic bonds.
sentences.chinese: 因此，这些几乎都是离子键。

sentences.english: Now, last day, we looked at the energetics of the ionic bond, right?
sentences.chinese: 昨天，我们讲的是离子键的热力学，对么？

sentences.english: So this is the energy of a single ionic bond.
sentences.chinese: 这就是单离子键的能量。

sentences.english: And so we got to ionic bonding.
sentences.chinese: 因此我们得到了离子键。

definition: simple substance (consisting purely of one element, such as diamond)
